title: CARTMANLAND
text: A bright, sunny day, with some clouds in the sky. The camera pans down to a funeral scene in a cemetery with robust trees

title: CARTMANLAND
text: ...And so it is with heavy hearts that we say good-bye to Mabel Louise Cartman. She was a good woman, a community leader, a caring wife, a providing mother , and a loving grandmother .

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Mom, it's 3:30! This is taking up my whole Saturday!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Ssshhh, pumpkin, it's almost over.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Why couldn't the funeral have been on a school day?

title: CARTMANLAND
text: And now, let us bow our heads in a moment of silence and reflect on how Mabel touched our lives.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: God! She didn't take this long to die!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: And now we release the doves to symbolize the Lord taking Mabel into his arms and giving her everlasting peace.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Peace.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Great! Now can we go?!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: No, sweetie, we have to tend to some of Grandma's business.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Ogh! God-damnit!!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: The city, day

title: CARTMANLAND
text: ...And so I leave my stocks and bonds, worth an estimate fourteen dollars and twelve cents, to be divided amongst my loving family.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Mom, I wanna go home!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: In a minute, sweetie. This is important.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: To my loving son, Stinky: I leave you the house in Nebraska. Look after it as your father and I did.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Bluh bluh bluhbluh bluh bluh!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: To my grandson Eric: You are always my favorite fat little man, my perfect round little pudding-piler.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Oh, God, do you have to embarrass me even in death, Grandma?!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: For you, Eric, I leave from my life savings, the sum of one million dollars, to be transferred to you immediately.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Hoosajiggawha?

title: CARTMANLAND
text: A million dollars?

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Eric is the primary benefactor of my estate, since it is likely the rest of you would spend the money on crack.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Oh my.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: That can't be!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Uh yah sir, excuse me: Du- Does this mean that I... have... one... million dollars?

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Yes, Eric, it's yours.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Nonowait, you don't understand:  since I was th-three years old it has been my dream to have one million dollars

title: CARTMANLAND
text: And now, you do.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Egh.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: South Park, day. A car with a woman seated in it appears on a hill

title: CARTMANLAND
text: "There you are, Jennifer Lopez!"  "You've been most uncooperative, Ms. Lopez."

title: CARTMANLAND
text: "No, please! I promise I'll never make another album or movie!"

title: CARTMANLAND
text: "It's too late for that, Ms. Lopez."

title: CARTMANLAND
text: "Have mercy!"  Yeah ha ha!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Yeah, awesome!  ...Why?

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Nuh uh.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: You'd better not be lying, Kenny.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: South Park, the Bank, later. Inside, a banker counts the money out in $100 bills. Mr. Garrison, Principal Victoria, Chef, and others are there.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Nine hundred ninety nine thousand four hundred, nine hundred ninety nine thousand five hundred...

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Damn, Ned, I've never seen that much cash.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Mm-me neither.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: ...Nine hundred ninety nine thousand nine hundred, one million.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Look at it. Look at it, mother. See how the light reflects the spearmint green from its surface.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Eric, that is a lot of money. Don't you think you should keep it in the bank instead of at your hosue?

title: CARTMANLAND
text: I'm not keeping it, Mr. Garrison, I'm spending it.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: On what?

title: CARTMANLAND
text: On my dream.  On the one thing that I've wanted ever since I could remember...

title: CARTMANLAND
text: South Park, the Bank, outside. Cartman leads the others out of the bank and down the street. The money is in hsi Radio Flyer wagon

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Excuse me son, I'm an investment broker; I can help you invest that money.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Nuh uh, I'm spendin' it.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Eric, God could sure use that money for a bigger church.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Huh, I think God has plenty of money.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: What the hell are you doing, fatass?!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Not much, just taking my  one million dollars out of the bank.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Oh my God.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Kenny wasn't lying.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Would you mind stepping aside? I have a purchase to make.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Dude, can you loan me twenty bucks for a new jacket?

title: CARTMANLAND
text: HA! If you need money, you can get a JOB, Stan! No freeloadeers are gonna take my hard-earned cash!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Your grandma left it to you! You didn't earn it!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Didn't earn it?! What about all the years I spent making Grandma like me?! All the wet spit-filled kisses I put up with?! The constant smell of aspirin and pee?! Don't tell me I didn't earn it, you son of a bitch!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: No... No, this isn't possible.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Yeah, it's unbelievable.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: No, I mean, this is impossible, Stan! Cartman is the biggest asshole in the world! How is it that God gives him a million dollars?

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Come on, we gotta see what Cartman is doing with his money.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Why? How could you do this? There are people starving in Alabama and... and you give Cartman a million dollars?

title: CARTMANLAND
text: North Park Funland, day. Cartman and his mom are in the park office signing papers

title: CARTMANLAND
text: ...Aaand if we can just get you to sign here...  and here... .

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Are you sure this is what you want, sweetie?

title: CARTMANLAND
text: My own amusement park, Mother. I'm sure.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: And now you just sign here, Mr. Foon.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: I can't do it.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: What?

title: CARTMANLAND
text: What?!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Uh uh I can't sell this poor kid my park.  Look, I haven't been honest with you. The park hasn't been doing great business.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Frank...

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Sshhhh. It ain't right, Chris.  The truth is, the park is a financial flop. I haven't turned a profit in years because I can't keep attendance up.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Oh, but I'm not buying the park to get people to come.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: You... you're not?

title: CARTMANLAND
text: No no no! I'm buying it to keep people out!  Don't you see? Forever it has been my dream to have my very own theme park, so that I could be alone in it, all day, every day. I love theme parks. But the lines! Everywhere you go, people, crowds,  The rides are great, but... All the lines, lines, LINES!  If there's one thing I hate,  all the lines, lines, lines, LINES!!  And then there get to be so many people  that they make FastPass. So then there's lines for FastPass. You stand in line to get a ticket to stand in line later. Then there's lines for the bathrooms , lines for the drinks , lines for cantakuras  and rare Kartankulas Plinks!  ...And, so you see, this park is for me. Nobody else will be allowed in it.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Nn-oh. Well then, I guess I don't feel bad.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Mr. Cartman, congratulations, the theme park is yours.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Gentlemen, I thank you.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: South Park Synangogue, night. A main door opens and Stan enters

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Kyle?  Dude, what are you doing here? Everybody's looking for you. Kyle?

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Do you know what happened to me this morning, Stan? This morning... I woke up and felt a sharp pain in my ass. I felt down there and, and found this... big sore lump. On my ass, Stan. I couldn't even sit down, so... I, I had to tell my mother, which, which was humiliating. She took me to the doctor, which was more humiliating, a- a- nd he told me. I-I have a hemorrhoid. It's like an infected blood vessel on your ass. I'm nine years old, and I have a hemorrhoid, Stan. I have a hemorrhoid, and, Cartman has his own theme park.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Kyle, I, I understand what you mean, but-

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Do you?! Do you, Stan?! Because all my life I was raised to believe in Jehovah! To believe that we should all behave a certain way and good things will come tu us. I make mistakes, but every week I try to better myself. I'm always saying, "You know, I learned something today..." and what does this so-called God give me in return? A hemorrhoid. He doesn't make sense!  What is your logic?!  Ow.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Look. Cartman... he thinks he's gonna be happy because he has his own amusement park, but, he's gonna find out that without other people, the rides are totally lame. I mean, who could really have fun by themselves at a theme park? I'll bet he's sick of it already.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: North Park Funland, day. Cartman is on the Carousel on a white horse, alone

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Yyeessss! Yyeessss!  Awesome!  Ho ho! Sweet!  Yes!  Folks, please keep your arms and legs inside the vehicle at all times, make sure your seatbelts are fastened, and enjoy the Mine Shaft! Yes!  Yes!  Oh, cool!  Oh, look how much fun I had!  Whoa! Heheheheh.  Ah! Heheh.  Whoa! Heh, heheh.  Woooo, Adventure Island! Check it out! Awesome!  Yoohoo! Yeh-hehess!  Yehess!  I'm so happy! I'm so happy!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Stan's house. Kyle enters carrying a padded seat ring

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Oh, hey dude. Terrance & Phillip is just about to start.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Great.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: What that?

title: CARTMANLAND
text: It's my seat ring. I have to sit on it because of my hemorrhoid.  Ow.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Heh, heh.  Sorry.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: So, how are things going at Cartman's theme park?!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Dude, just forget about it. We can't let him get to us, or he wins.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Hunh, I guess you're right.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Hey, everybody! Check out the all new Cartmanland! It's our Graaand Opening! Cartmanland has over a hundred fabulous rides , six roller coasters , and tons of great surprises!  And the best part is:  You can't come!!  That's right, because at Cartmanland, only I, Eric Cartman, can get in! That means only I can ride the all-new Tornado Twister , a roller coaster that splashes in the water! Wow!  It's the greatest amusement park in the Colorado area! And nobody can go!! Especially Stan and Kyle!! HAHA!!  So come on down to Cartmanland now!  But don't plan on getting past the parking lot,  'cause remember: So much to do at Cartmanland, but you can't come!  Especially you, Stan and Kyle.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: That does it, dude!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Where are we going?

title: CARTMANLAND
text: We're getting into that fatass's park whether he likes it or not!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Cartmanland, Haunted Mansion, night. Cartman is back on the ride.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Whoa! Heheh.  Whoa!  Whoa! Heheheheheh. Aw, man, that was awesohome! That one part, with the-uum, with the spider that dropped on ya? Oho, man, that totally got me. That was sweet! Heheh.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Ah! Ow! Hey, it hurts!  Owie-ow! Help! Ow, that hurts!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: What the hell?

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Hohohooho! Oowwww!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: You sons of bitches!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Cartmanland, perimeter fence. Stan is in the park waiting for Kyle to come down, but Kyle is stranded on top of the fence. The view is from the park towards the parking lot.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Come on, dude!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Hoh Gohod, I popped it!! Oh hit huhurts!!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: What the hell are you doing?!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Aw, crap.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Oho God, get me off of here!!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Dude!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Stahan, I have to go home!! I need my cream!! I need my creeheam!!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Alright, let's go.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: That's right! You stay out!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: You can't keep us out forever, you fucking fastass! We'll be back as soon as Kyle's hemorrhoid is better!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: My life can't get any worse!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: You'll see! We'll get in!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: ...Alright, so listen: All I want you to do is keep anybody out who tries to get in here. If you see anybody on my propertih, especially Stan and Kyle, you are to shoot on sight!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: So what does does this job pay?

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Alright, now this is very hard for me to do, you understand. But, in return for you working security, I'll let you ride two rides a day. But only two rides, and only if I'm not on them.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Uh, I'm afraid I don't really like rides.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: But, you can ride anything you want. And you don't have to wait in line.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: I'm not interested.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Dude, are you from Mars or something? Any ride you want. No lines.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: If you need security, I need a cash salary.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: But I don't have any cash. I spent everything on this park.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Well, look: Why don't you just let a couple of people in each day? Every day you can just let two people in, charge $29.95 per ticket, and then you can use that to pay my daily salary.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Ugh. Two people?

title: CARTMANLAND
text: This place is huge. You'll never notice two people. And then you'll have security for your park.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Well, all alright, Goddamnit! I'll open the park to two people each day! But remember: anybody else you see trespassing the park...

title: CARTMANLAND
text: I will shoot on sight.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Sweet.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Hell's Pass Hospital, day. Kyle is on a gurney face down. A doctor stands behind him as his parents look on

title: CARTMANLAND
text: You're a very lucky little boy. I've never seen a hemorrhoid so infected. It could have killed you.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Sucky.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Oh, look, Kyle. Your little friend Stan is here to see you.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Dude, are you okay?

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Oh, I'm swell, Stan. I popped my hemorrhoid trying to climb the fence into Cartmanland, and it got infected. I really need to go to the bathroom, but if I do, it will pop again and the pain will make me pass out. How are you?

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Well um, ah-I found out that Cartman is letting a few people each day into his theme park. I wa thinking we could put on disguises and get in.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Ah-ah-ah-I'm afraid Kyle can't ride any amusement park rides for over a year because of his horrible hemorrhoid.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Jesus.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: But it's okay, Stan, because I finally figured it out. You see, if someone like Cartman can get a million dollars and his own theme park, then there is no God. There's no God, dude.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Kyle, don't say such things!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Why? Why, Mom? Because if I do something bad will happen to me? Because if I do your God might not shower me with his blessings of infected hemorrhoids?

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Kyle, youyouyou just don't understand. It's-

title: CARTMANLAND
text: No! I finally do understand! There is no justice! There is no God!. Do you hear me?! I renounce my faith!!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Cartmanland, day. Barbed wire has been placed atop every fence imaginable. A crowd of people shows up. Among the people are Butters, Clyde, Jordan, Bebe...

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Alrightalright, listen up, people. Cartmanland is open, but only to two people each day.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Aw.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: That's gay.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: I just gotta cover my security expenses. Butters, Clyde, you can come in.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Hoh.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Oh.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: The rest of you will just have to try another day.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Aw.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: 'K, one park admission? That will be twenty-nine ninety five, sir.  Five cents is your change and enjoy your stay at Cartmanland.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Hoh boy, oh boy!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: ...and enjoy your stay at Cartmanland. Ogh, finally, work is over. Now I can get back to riding my rides.  Dada da, I've got my own theme park. Hm, what should I go on now? I know! I'll go on the Haunted Mansion ride again! Da dait daa da Da dat dadadadadadaa da-ah-  What are you doing?

title: CARTMANLAND
text: We're waitin' in line for the-ah spook house.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Line? Lines! I HATE LINES!!! Can't you go on something else right now?

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Well we wanna see the spook house. Uh well, we paid twenty-nine ninety five; we should be able to go in the spook house.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Yeah! But I think it's broke down. The cars aren't moving.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Ugh, alrightalright, hang on.  Security!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: What?

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Oh, Jesus! Uh, look, the haunted house ride broke down. I need you to fix it.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Uh, I'm security, not maintenance.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: But I don't know how it works.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Well your rides are gonna break down every now and then. You need to hire a maintenance person.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Ogh, alrightalright! I'll let two more people in each day so I can hire a maintenance person.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Cartmanland, another day. A crowd of people shows up. Among the people are Bebe, Token, Timmy, Kenny, Filmore...

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Alright folks, we've had another change in policy. I've had to hire a maintenance person, and to pay his salary I have to let in two more people a day.  However, the stupid maintenance worker demanded I have food and drinks inside the park, so now I've had to hire a beverage person, and a cotton-candy person, which means I now have to let eight people come in a day! BUT, you are to try your best not to ride any rides that I am on! Understood?  Alright, let's go.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Timmay!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Wait a minute! Who are you?

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Mike Gainor.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: HA! Get the hell out of here, Stan!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Goddamnit Cartman, let me in!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: I thought you said buying a theme park was stupid! SECURITY!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: It is stupid, Cartman! You made Kyle lose his faith in God, you fat asshole!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Get him out of here!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Move along, sir.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: AAAH!  This isn't over, Cartman!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Eugh. Well, now I can finally get back to my riding my rides!  Uh oh! Oh man, I'm so scared!  AAAAaaaa....

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Hell's Pass Hospital, day. A nurse works on Kyle's hemorrhoid with pincers

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Ah!  Aaah!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Just a little more  There we go.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Hello, Kyle. How's the hemorrhoid today?

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Awesome.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Kyle, we wanna tell you about the book of Job. It's a story from the Bible.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: I've had enough of the Bible. What has it gotten me?

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Oh, I think you'll see differently after hearing this. Sit down, Kyle.  Uh, okay. You see, Job lived in the east of Jordan a long long time ago.  Job was a great man. He was blessed with ten lovely children , a wonderful wife, and many friends.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: He was godly, and a good man, and fed the poor.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: He was the most upright and honorable of men, and every day he praised God.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: But one day, Satan went up to heaven and talked to God.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Satan talked to God?

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Yes, in the book of Job, Satan talks to God. And God says to Satan, "Have you seen Job? He is a great man, and he praises me every day."

title: CARTMANLAND
text: But Satan said, "Oh yeah? He only praises you because you gave him so much. If you didn't give him those things, he would curse your name."

title: CARTMANLAND
text: To which God said, "Oh yeah? I'll show you, Satan! I'll take those things away from Job and he will still praise my name."

title: CARTMANLAND
text: And so, God had a bunch of barbarians come in and slaughter Job's oxen and donkeys, and murder all his workers.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Then God sent his fireballs from the sky and killed his sheep and the rest of his employees.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: And then, as Job's sons and daughters were eating, God sent a mighty wind to collapse the house and crush and kill them all.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Job was terribly sad, but he fell to his knees and said, "The Lord giveth, and the Lord taketh away," and praised God's name.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: So then, Job got painful sores all over his body.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: He was in terrible, miserable pain all day, every day. But he still kept his faith.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: God said to Sata, "See? I told you. Job still praises me."

title: CARTMANLAND
text: And that's it? That's the end?

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Basically.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: That's the most horrible story I've ever heard. Why would God do such a horrible thing to a good person just to prove a point to Satan?

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Oh. Uhhh, I don't know.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Then I was right. Job has all his children killed, and Michael Bay gets to keep making movies. There isn't a God.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Cartmanland, day. Yet another crowd of people awaits to get in. Cartman greets them

title: CARTMANLAND
text: ...And, since the stupid security guard needs video surveillance, I have to let in two more people a day to cover those expenses... Need to cover the new ticket guy's salary, so that's three more admissions a day...  Cleanup crew for the bathroom, money to cover paint and upkeep - so that's about four admissions - that brings the grand total to... God-damnit!  Eight hundred and sixteen people can come into the park today!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Welcome to Cartmanland.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Hell's Pass Hospital, day. The doctor has been in to see Kyle's recovery progress and is now talking to the parents

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Isn't he getting any better, doctor?

title: CARTMANLAND
text: I don't understand it. He's not fighting the infected hemorrhoid at all. It's like he... like he's lost all hope. Well if you'll excuse me, I've got more tests to run.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: And now back to Money Quest, on HBC.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Welcome back to Money Quest.  In just over two weeks, young financial genius Eric Cartman  has managed to turn a theme park that was seeing less than a hundred attendees a day into a thriving park with attendance in the thousands.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: And the way he did it is with the brilliant "You Can't Come" technique. For the first several days, the young businessman saturated the market with the claim that nobody could get into his park. It made the public crazy. So then, weeks later, when he opened the doors, they were lining up around the block. Simply amazing.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Well, ahah I thnk we should point out that this technique is already being applied by businesses all over the country.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: At a restaurant where all the tables are empty and everyone is waiting in line...

title: CARTMANLAND
text: I'm sorry, we're no longer taking reservations. Nobody can eat here. You'll have to leave now.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: At the Bijou, where everyone is waiting outside....

title: CARTMANLAND
text: No, I'm sorry. You can't see this movie. Nobody can see this movie. I can't even go in.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: At Gracy's clothing store, a sales associates barks orders...

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Out! Nobody is allowed into Gracy's anymore! Get out of here!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Back to Money Quest...

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Amazing. Eric Cartman is surely the financial genius of our time.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Back to Kyle's room at Hell's Pass Hospital...

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Oh. Oohh.Ohuhughughhh.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Kyle? Kyle?  Get the doctor!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Cartmanland, day. Every ride has people on it, and every ride Cartman is on shows a dejected Cartman as the others enjoy themselves. At the Carousel he rides his favorite white horse, but shows no joy in riding it. At Java Jam!!! he's in a purple teacup with three other kids, and is not enjoying it. At Bumbper Buggies he's in the #7 bumper car

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Eh!  Goddamnit, stop running into me!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: (Woohoo!)  (Heeheehee!!)

title: CARTMANLAND
text: AGH!  DAAAAAAH!!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Cartmanland, Main Street. The crowds bustle about and business is good. Chris the Broker and Mr. Foon are seen walking down Main Street.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: My God, look at it, Chris! That kid completely turned this place around!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: He sure did!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Oh, if I could only have a park that worked like this!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Hey, there you are!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Oh, hello. Congratulations on your success.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Just give me my money back.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: What?

title: CARTMANLAND
text: I changed my mind! I don't want your stupid park!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: ...But it's doing great!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: You call this great?! I call it Hell! Trade me back, Goddamnit!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: You bet! I'll go get your money right now!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Daddy, daddy, can we ride the rockets?

title: CARTMANLAND
text: GODDAMNIT GET THE FUCK OUT OF MY WAY!!!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Hell's Pass Hospital, day. The doctor has brought Kyle's vitals back, and Kyle is on oxygen, but he's still unconscious. Gerald and Sheila look on

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Isn't he responding at all, doctor?

title: CARTMANLAND
text: I'm sorry. Your son appears to be losing the battle. I'm afraid that the hemorrhoid has spread to his lungs. Normally, the body would fight the infection, but he's... he's just... given up on life.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: But then... are you saying...?

title: CARTMANLAND
text: There's nothing I can do. Little fella's just... lost his will to live.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Oh Kyle! Kyle, you've got to fight!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Cartmanland... ahem, North Park Funland, day. The old North Park Funland sign is being restored, as are many of the rides Cartman replaced. The ticket booths are missing. A bulldozer sits outside the park ready to clear out anything else that needs removal. Cartman exits with the million dollars he originally paid for the park. The money is back on the Radio Flyer

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Good riddance, you stupid park! You can all kiss my ass!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Excuse me? Eric Cartman?

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Yeah?

title: CARTMANLAND
text: I'm Frank Garrett with the IRS. You haven't kept records of your income or payout, and there's a five hundred thousand dollar discrepancy.  Seize the assets.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: He- Hey, that's my money!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: There's also the lawsuit of the little boy who died in your park. The family's entitled to the rest of this.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: What?! Kenny?! He dies all the time!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: You still owe thirteen thousand dollars more than this, Mr. Cartman. We'll see you in court.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Yeh- You can't take my money, Goddamnit!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: We know how well your park is doing; you'll make it back in no time.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: No! But I don't... ah... ah...  Hey! Hey Mr. Foon, I changed my mind. I need the park to make my money back.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Nohoho way, José!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: But I'm getting sued now. If I don't have the park I lose everything!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: "I don't care," said Pierre. "I'm from France."

title: CARTMANLAND
text: This can't be happening! AAAAAHH!!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Hell's Pass Hospital, day. Stan bursts into Kyle's room

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Kyle, you gotta see!!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Kyle's not going to make it, Stanley. Oh, Gerald!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Doctor, can we wheel Kyle out of here on his bed with the machines attached?

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Well, I sssuppsed it could be rigged, but I-

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Then damnit man, do it!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: North Park Funland, day. The ticket booths are back, and business is as strong now as it was when the park was Cartmanland. Off to the side, Cartman is throwing stones at one of the park walls

title: CARTMANLAND
text: It isn't fair!  You Goddamned assholes, it isn't fair!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Look, Kyle. Look.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Huh?

title: CARTMANLAND
text: You just build me up to chop me down, didn't you?! What about my dream?! What about my money?!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Huh?

title: CARTMANLAND
text: I'M SO PISSED OFF!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Move along, sir! You are vandalizing private property!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Ey! You used to work for me!  Ut ut aw! Aw, Goddamnit, you sonfofabitch!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Kyle!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: He's coming back.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: That's it, baby. That's it.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Oho, Goddamnit, this sucks!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Wait a minute. Yes! The hemorrhoid is going into remission!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Oh, shih.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: Look, Kyle, Cartman is totally miserable. Even more miserable than he was before because he's had his dream and lost it.

title: CARTMANLAND
text: It's not fair! It's not fair; I wanna die! I wanna daaahahie!

title: CARTMANLAND
text: You are up there!
